  "description": "Trucrete Solutions Limited is dynamic Construction Management firm with expertise in Infrastructural Development, Engineering Services, Procurement, Facility Management, and General Contracting. With several groundbreaking engineering projects in our portfolio over the years, Trucrete is proud to have been involved in shaping Nigeria by elevating critical infrastructure to international standards, erecting buildings, bridges, flyovers and roads in key strategic locations in Nigeria. We have helped create a safer and more pleasant environment, all while encouraging state growth and development.

Our fleet of plant machinery and equipment gives us the capacity to successfully undertake multiple projects in various parts of Nigeria at any one time, while our network of tried and tested subcontractors and suppliers throughout the country and globally, enables us to procure the best resources for every project.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Quality Assurance / Quality Control Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Responsibilities


	Ensure the contents of the project Quality plan, Inspection and Test plans, QA and QC procedures, and inspection records are implemented.
	Ensure all works are carried out in accordance with the scope of works, project specifications and drawings
	Maintain quality records such as request for inspection, inspection/audit reports, QAQC checklists, equipment calibrations plan, issues log, rework schedule, risk register, non-conformance/corrective &amp; preventive action reports.
	Conduct Quality audits of TSL projects as instructed by the TSL Quality Manager.
	Record and report immediately all and any deviation from the scope of works, project specifications and drawings
	Work closely with the TSL QAQC Laboratory team and ensure relevant test on projects align with TSL laboratory test procedure, project specific and regulatory requirements.
	Ensure all equipment used in the test and measurement are within calibration and have all the required calibration certificates.
	Assisting in the investigation of non-conformances and making recommendations for corrective action.
	Approve incoming materials conformity to specifications, conducting visual and measurement test, and rejecting/returning of non-conforming materials.
	Assisting TSL QAQC Manager in the development and training of QAQC personnel.
	Attend QA/QC meetings and record minutes and actions.
	Ensure TSL QAQC Policy and Plan are implemented on projects.
	Check and report the discrepancies found on approved drawing to Quality Manager for modifications.
	Attend project site meetings and any other regular meeting as defined in the QA system.
	Identify, document and communicate quality related issues and possible quality risks in all operations and third-party contractors to QAQC manager.
	Work closely with and provide assistance to the project team members.
	Responsible for the implementation of inspections and test plans on projects.
	Report weekly activities to the QAQC Manager.
	Coordinate, guide and supervise QAQC Engineers on assigned project.
	Ensure Periodic performance Evaluation of third-party contractor/vendor on projects.
	Participate in punch list inspection/clearing for handover.
	Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading technical publications, attending seminars, watching industry videos etc.
	Any other duty as assigned by the QAQC manager.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Civil, or Construction Engineering.
	Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in QA/QC roles within the construction or infrastructure industry.
	Attention to detail and commitment to quality excellence.
	In-depth knowledge of construction materials, standards, and testing procedures.
	Excellent understanding of quality management systems (QMS), ISO standards, and project specifications.
	Proven experience in document control, quality reporting, and audit procedures.
	Strong analytical, organizational, and leadership skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Strong leadership and supervisory ability.
	Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
	Effective communication and report writing.
	Integrity, accountability, and professionalism.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities under pressure.


Method of Application&nbsp;

title: Job Vacancies at Biz Afric Solutions
content:
Biz Afric is all about helping businesses thrive in Africa by assisting them with a wide range of business support services, including human resources, business development, digital strategy, research, data analysis, forecasting, and any other areas of their business needs.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Business Development Executive

Job Location: Hybrid Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time  (Hybrid)

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Business Development Executive will drive growth by identifying new business opportunities, building strategic partnerships, and promoting the company reach to different healthcare services provider.
	The role requires a strong understanding of the healthcare market, excellent relationship management skills, and the ability to develop innovative strategies to increase patient acquisition, corporate accounts, and referral networks.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities with corporate organizations, HMOs, government agencies, NGOs, and community health programs.
	Identify, research, and pursue new business opportunities in hospitals, diagnostic centers, HMOs, pharmacies, and public health institutions.
	Develop and execute sales and partnership strategies to meet revenue and expansion targets.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers, industry stakeholders, and clients.
	Conduct market research to understand healthcare trends, competitors, and emerging technology opportunities.
	Prepare and deliver compelling presentations, demos, and proposals tailored to client needs.
	Collaborate with the technical and product teams to align client requirements with product offerings.
	Lead the negotiation and closing of business deals and manage post-sales relationships for long-term growth.
	Represent the company at healthcare conferences, exhibitions, and networking events.
	Track and report business development performance using CRM tools and data insights.
	Provide feedback from the market to inform product improvement and innovation.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in business development, preferably in healthcare or service-based industries.
	Proven ability to meet sales or growth targets.
	Strong networking, communication, and presentation skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.
	Good understanding of healthcare operations and the hospital market environment is an advantage.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 20th December, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Culture and Growth Manager

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration:  6 – 12 Months (Extendable)
Work Mode: 5 Days and two alternate half-day Saturdays

Role Summary


	The Culture and Growth Manager is a multi-disciplinary leadership role responsible for nurturing a high-performing, motivated team while driving the people-side of business growth.
	The ideal candidate will enhance internal team culture, lead talent development efforts, and collaborate cross-functionally to support organizational goals across international placements, curated events, and strategic expansion.
	This person serves as the bridge between people's experience and business outcomes—ensuring the team is inspired, supported, and aligned with the company’s mission to deliver transformative education services.


Key Responsibilities


	Foster a positive and inclusive work culture in hybrid and remote settings.
	Design and manage onboarding, team-building, feedback, and employee engagement initiatives.
	Implement professional development plans and track learning progress across departments.
	Develop a system for employee performance tracking and reward recognition.
	Work closely with leadership to align people strategies with revenue, partnership, and placement goals.
	Support the scaling of business operations, including recruitment for project-based roles (e.g. education fair support, outreach teams).
	Contribute to internal workflows and SOPs that improve efficiency and client delivery.
	Provide operational support for international student recruitment, partner school engagement, and post-event conversion tracking.
	Collaborate with events and placement teams to ensure adequate staffing, training, and support before, during, and after events.
	Ensure all team members involved in education fairs or webinars are well-prepared and aligned on deliverables.
	Lead post-event debriefs and internal performance analysis to identify process improvements.
	Manage internal communication systems, updates, and platforms (Slack, Trello, Notion, etc.).
	Create moments of connection: virtual check-ins, shoutouts, wellness challenges, and shared learning sessions.
	Act as a cultural ambassador—monitoring team morale, promoting core values, and flagging burnout or support needs.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Organizational Development, or related field. Master’s degree or HR/Leadership certifications (CIPM, SHRM, etc.) is a plus.
	4 – 6 years of experience in a role combining HR, operations, and organizational development.
	Proven experience leading or supporting teams in high-growth, project-based, or service-oriented environments.
	Background in international education, events, consulting, or student services is highly desirable.
	Strong people leadership, emotional intelligence, and team-building capabilities.
	Ability to develop and implement people-centric systems and processes.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strategic thinker with strong problem-solving and decision-making ability.
	Comfortable working with productivity tools (Google Suite, Trello, HRIS platforms, Slack, etc.)


What Success Looks Like:


	Increased team engagement and retention in a growing organization.
	Streamlined onboarding and learning systems for faster team productivity.
	Well-executed event staffing and support with clear internal coordination.
	Direct contribution to a more structured, data-informed approach to business growth.


Salary
Open to negotiation.

Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Sales Manager (Entry Level)

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Sales and Marketing
Job Mode: 5 Days Per Week (Flexible after 12 months )

The Role Overview


	Sales manager is a vibrant connector, opportunity amplifier, and education matchmaker - both online and offline.
	They will combine their passion for international education with people skills, marketing creativity, and grassroots selling to inspire students and help them take bold steps toward studying abroad. They’re not just selling a service - they’re selling the possibility.


Key Responsibilities


	Scout and engage prospective students through: School visits, university outreaches, and youth gatherings
	Referrals, one-on-one chats, and networking in educational spaces
	Track and follow up on leads via phone, WhatsApp, or in-person meetings
	Pitch study-abroad programs in a way that inspires trust and excitement
	Convert inquiries into active applications by clearly explaining benefits and processes
	Build meaningful connections with students, parents, counselors, and community leaders
	Represent the brand at educational events, roadshows, and fairs
	Distribute marketing materials and generate leads through face-to-face conversations
	Organize info sessions, booth setups, and informal gatherings where students hang out
	Assist in promoting programs via WhatsApp status, Instagram, and email newsletters
	Support digital campaigns with local stories, testimonials, and creative content
	Help students understand application requirements
	Collect necessary documents and guide them through the application and placement process
	Provide follow-up support until final placement or visa submission


Job Requirements


	Confident speaker in both formal (presentations) and informal (student chats) settings
	Past experience in campus leadership, sales, or youth programs
	A passion for global learning and storytelling
	Able to speak confidently to both students and parents
	Natural networker and persuasive communicator
	Self-motivated, persuasive, approachable, and culturally aware Excellent follow-up and organizational skills.
	Comfortable using WhatsApp Business, Google Workspace, and Canva
	Familiar with CRM tools (or ready to learn)
	Social media literate (especially Instagram, TikTok, Facebook).


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 (Negotiable)

Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.
